accurate_docstring: When in morningPatientCare, monitor the vitals of patient, remind the patient to take their morning medication, set the lighting in the room to bright, and set the room temperature to 22°C. When in afternoonPatientCare, monitor the vitals of patient, remind the patient to take their afternoon medication, set the lighting in the room to medium, and set the room temperature to 23°C. When in nightPatientCare, monitor the vitals of patient, remind the patient to take their night medication, set the lighting in the room to dim, and set the room temperature to 21°C.
template_docstring: WHEN in morningPatientCare, DO monitor the vitals of patient; remind the patient to take their morning medication; set the lighting in the room to bright; set the room temperature to 22°C; WHEN in afternoonPatientCare, DO monitor the vitals of patient; remind the patient to take their afternoon medication; set the lighting in the room to medium; set the room temperature to 23°C; WHEN in nightPatientCare, DO monitor the vitals of patient; remind the patient to take their night medication; set the lighting in the room to dim; set the room temperature to 21°C.

accurate_docstring: When in the morningPatientRoutine, monitor the vital signs of patient1. If the heart rate is greater than 100, administer a beta-blocker to patient1. Alert medical staff that the morning patient monitoring is completed. When in the afternoonPatientRoutine, monitor the vital signs of patient2. If the blood pressure is greater than 140, administer an antihypertensive to patient2. Alert medical staff that the afternoon patient monitoring is completed. When in the eveningPatientRoutine, monitor the vital signs of patient3. If the temperature is greater than 38, administer an antipyretic to patient3. Alert medical staff that the evening patient monitoring is completed.
template_docstring: WHEN in the morningPatientRoutine, DO monitor the vital signs of patient1; IF the heart rate is greater than 100, THEN administer a beta-blocker to patient1; alert medical staff that the morning patient monitoring is completed; WHEN in the afternoonPatientRoutine, DO monitor the vital signs of patient2; IF the blood pressure is greater than 140, THEN administer an antihypertensive to patient2; alert medical staff that the afternoon patient monitoring is completed; WHEN in the eveningPatientRoutine, DO monitor the vital signs of patient3; IF the temperature is greater than 38, THEN administer an antipyretic to patient3; alert medical staff that the evening patient monitoring is completed.

accurate_docstring: When in the morningGlucoseRoutine, monitor the glucose levels of patient1. If the glucose levels are greater than 180, adjust the insulin pump to 5 units. Notify the caregiver that the morning glucose monitoring is completed. When in the afternoonGlucoseRoutine, monitor the glucose levels of patient2. If the glucose levels are less than 70, notify the caregiver that low glucose levels were detected in patient2. Notify the caregiver that the afternoon glucose monitoring is completed. When in the eveningGlucoseRoutine, monitor the glucose levels of patient3. If the glucose levels are greater than 200, adjust the insulin pump to 6 units. Notify the caregiver that the evening glucose monitoring is completed.
template_docstring: WHEN in the morningGlucoseRoutine, DO monitor the glucose levels of patient1; IF the glucose levels are greater than 180, THEN adjust the insulin pump to 5 units; notify the caregiver that the morning glucose monitoring is completed; WHEN in the afternoonGlucoseRoutine, DO monitor the glucose levels of patient2; IF the glucose levels are less than 70, THEN notify the caregiver that low glucose levels were detected in patient2; notify the caregiver that the afternoon glucose monitoring is completed; WHEN in the eveningGlucoseRoutine, DO monitor the glucose levels of patient3; IF the glucose levels are greater than 200, THEN adjust the insulin pump to 6 units; notify the caregiver that the evening glucose monitoring is completed.

accurate_docstring: When in the morningOxygenRoutine, monitor the oxygen levels of patient1. If the oxygen levels are below 90, adjust the oxygen supply to 3 liters. Notify the family that the morning oxygen monitoring is completed. When in the afternoonOxygenRoutine, monitor the oxygen levels of patient2. If the oxygen levels are below 92, adjust the oxygen supply to 2 liters. Notify the family that the afternoon oxygen monitoring is completed. When in the eveningOxygenRoutine, monitor the oxygen levels of patient3. If the oxygen levels are below 88, adjust the oxygen supply to 4 liters. Notify the family that the evening oxygen monitoring is completed.
template_docstring: WHEN in the morningOxygenRoutine, DO monitor the oxygen levels of patient1; IF the oxygen levels are below 90, THEN adjust the oxygen supply to 3 liters; notify the family that the morning oxygen monitoring is completed; WHEN in the afternoonOxygenRoutine, DO monitor the oxygen levels of patient2; IF the oxygen levels are below 92, THEN adjust the oxygen supply to 2 liters; notify the family that the afternoon oxygen monitoring is completed; WHEN in the eveningOxygenRoutine, DO monitor the oxygen levels of patient3; IF the oxygen levels are below 88, THEN adjust the oxygen supply to 4 liters; notify the family that the evening oxygen monitoring is completed.

accurate_docstring: When in morningHealthcareRoutine, monitor the patient's vitals, check if the heart rate is over 100 and alert emergency services if necessary, send a medication reminder for morning medication. When in afternoonHealthcareRoutine, monitor the patient's vitals, check if the heart rate is over 100 and alert emergency services if necessary, send a medication reminder for afternoon medication. When in eveningHealthcareRoutine, monitor the patient's vitals, check if the heart rate is over 100 and alert emergency services if necessary, send a medication reminder for evening medication, and prepare the patient for overnight care.
template_docstring: WHEN in morningHealthcareRoutine, DO monitor the patient's vitals; check IF the heart rate is over 100, THEN alert emergency services if necessary; send a medication reminder for morning medication; WHEN in afternoonHealthcareRoutine, DO monitor the patient's vitals; check IF the heart rate is over 100, THEN alert emergency services if necessary; send a medication reminder for afternoon medication; WHEN in eveningHealthcareRoutine, DO monitor the patient's vitals; check IF the heart rate is over 100, THEN alert emergency services if necessary; send a medication reminder for evening medication; prepare the patient for overnight care.

accurate_docstring: When in the morningSchoolRoutine, monitor the CO2 levels in classroom101. If the CO2 levels exceed 1000 ppm, increase the ventilation. Monitor the light levels in classroom101. If the light levels are below 300 lux, increase the lighting. Monitor the temperature in classroom101. If the temperature is below 20°C, adjust the HVAC to heating. Notify the administration that the morning school routine is completed. In the afternoonSchoolRoutine, monitor the CO2 levels in classroom102. If the CO2 levels exceed 800 ppm, increase the ventilation. Monitor the light levels in classroom102. If the light levels exceed 700 lux, decrease the lighting. Monitor the temperature in classroom102. If the temperature is above 24°C, adjust the HVAC to cooling. Notify the administration that the afternoon school routine is completed. In the eveningSchoolRoutine, monitor the CO2 levels in classroom103. If the CO2 levels exceed 1200 ppm, increase the ventilation. Monitor the light levels in classroom103. If the light levels are below 200 lux, increase the lighting. Monitor the temperature in classroom103. If the temperature is below 18°C, adjust the HVAC to heating. Notify the administration that the evening school routine is completed.
template_docstring: WHEN in the morningSchoolRoutine, DO monitor the CO2 levels in classroom101; IF the CO2 levels exceed 1000 ppm, THEN increase the ventilation; monitor the light levels in classroom101; IF the light levels are below 300 lux, THEN increase the lighting; monitor the temperature in classroom101; IF the temperature is below 20°C, THEN adjust the HVAC to heating; notify the administration that the morning school routine is completed; WHEN in the afternoonSchoolRoutine, DO monitor the CO2 levels in classroom102; IF the CO2 levels exceed 800 ppm, THEN increase the ventilation; monitor the light levels in classroom102; IF the light levels exceed 700 lux, THEN decrease the lighting; monitor the temperature in classroom102; IF the temperature is above 24°C, THEN adjust the HVAC to cooling; notify the administration that the afternoon school routine is completed; WHEN in the eveningSchoolRoutine, DO monitor the CO2 levels in classroom103; IF the CO2 levels exceed 1200 ppm, THEN increase the ventilation; monitor the light levels in classroom103; IF the light levels are below 200 lux, THEN increase the lighting; monitor the temperature in classroom103; IF the temperature is below 18°C, THEN adjust the HVAC to heating; notify the administration that the evening school routine is completed.
